snippet: California, the state that ended racial quotas, fortified its borders and limited bilingual education, now faces a reality in which minorities are the majority.    New census data indicate that blacks, Hispanics and Asians outnumber non-Hispanic w...
lead_paragraph: California, the state that ended racial quotas, fortified its borders and limited bilingual education, now faces a reality in which minorities are the majority. New census data indicate that blacks, Hispanics and Asians outnumber non-Hispanic whites, a shift that could transform California's political dynamics and social priorities in the years to come.
abstract: Census Bureau figures show blacks, Hispanics and Asians in California together outnumber non-Hispanic whites, who have slipped into minority for first time with only 49.8 percent of state's population (S)

headline.main: National News Briefs; Non-Hispanic Whites Are California Minority
